alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 4:06AM CDT until September 24 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas, including the following counties, Carroll, Crawford, Franklin, Madison and Washington AR. Portions of northeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Adair. * WHEN...Until 715 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 406 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Stilwell... Ozark... Huntsville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Elkins... Tontitown... West Fork... Lincoln... Westville... Greenland... Winslow... Chester... St. Paul... Hindsville... Wiederkehr Village... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
